title: kit.alias configs do not pass to Vite

labels.name: p1-important
labels.description: SvelteKit cannot be used by a large number of people, basic functionality is missing, etc.

milestone.description: stuff we need to nail down before launch

body:
### Describe the bug

Thanks for your efforts.

From the docs here: https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/configuration#alias

> An object containing zero or more aliases used to replace values in import statements. **These aliases are automatically passed to Vite and TypeScript.**

I'm led to believe the `kit.alias` config is the one-stop destination for all things aliases. To my observation, it only impacts the aliases built by `npx svelte-kit sync` and output to `.svelte-kit/tsconfig.json`. This helps with import intellisense and ESLint checks, but Vite apparently is not made aware of the aliases.

### Reproduction

1. Go to https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltekit-alias?file=svelte.config.js&terminal=dev
2. Observe configs in **svelte.config.js**
3. Run `npm run dev` (should start automatically) and note the error

### Logs

```shell
Cannot find module '$components/Hello.svelte' imported from '/home/projects/sveltekit-alias/src/routes/+page.svelte'
```


### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Linux 5.0 undefined
    CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9880H CPU @ 2.30GHz
    Memory: 0 Bytes / 0 Bytes
    Shell: 1.0 - /bin/jsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.14.2 - /usr/local/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.10 - /bin/yarn
    npm: 7.17.0 - /bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.64 
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.413 
    svelte: ^3.46.0 => 3.49.0 
    vite: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.8
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

By applying aliases in both `svelte.config.js@kit.alias` and `vite.config.js@resolve.alias` I am able to have Typescript and Vite acknowledge my aliases. 

Here is the workaround applied: https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltekit-alias-workaround?file=svelte.config.js,vite.config.js&terminal=dev

Convenience link to Vite docs: https://vitejs.dev/config/shared-options.html#resolve-alias
